intro: Stellaria fennica, commonly known as the Finnish starwort, is a small herbaceous plant native to northern regions of Europe and Asia. It typically grows in moist, calcareous soils in mountainous and subarctic environments. The plant features a basal rosette of narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, white or pale blue flowers with five petals. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, and it is often found in alpine meadows and tundra habitats. Stellaria fennica is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, known for its delicate appearance and ecological significance in cold climates.
